question: Which country's largest national park is "Monte Alen National Park"?
explanation: Monte Alen National Park is an IUCN category II national park established in 1960 in Equatorial Guinea. It is the largest national park of Equatorial Guinea. The Uoro River flows through this national park. This national park forms the catchment area of Lake Atoc. This national park houses the biggest frog species in the world, the Goliath Frog.
